label: seminoma
definition: A radiosensitive malignant germ cell tumor found in the testis (especially undescended), and extragonadal sites (anterior mediastinum and pineal gland). It is characterized by the presence of uniform cells with clear or dense cytoplasm which contains glycogen, and by a large nucleus which contains one or more nucleoli. The neoplastic germ cells form aggregates separated by fibrous septa. The fibrous septa contain chronic inflammatory cells, mainly lymphocytes.
synonyms: seminoma, malignant, seminoma, seminoma, pure

label: seminal vesicle tumor
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the seminal vesicle. Representative examples include cystadenoma and adenocarcinoma.
synonyms: neoplasm of seminal vesicle, seminal vesicle neoplasm, tumor of seminal vesicle, tumour of seminal vesicle, seminal vesicle neoplasm (disease), seminal vesicle tumor

label: sella turcica neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that occurs in sella turcica. Representative examples include craniopharyngioma and pituitary gland adenoma.
synonyms: sellar tumor, tumour of the sella turcica, sellar neoplasm, sellar tumour, neoplasm of the sella turcica, sella turcica tumor, tumor of sella turcica, tumour of sella turcica, sella turcica tumour, tumor of the sella turcica, neoplasm of sella turcica, sella turcica neoplasm

label: selective immunoglobulin deficiency disease
definition: A broad classification of dysgammaglobulinemias characterized by low or undetectable serum levels of one of the five immunoglobulin classes. Deficiencies of immunoglobulins present variably according to isotype. Selective deficiencies may be caused by decreased or inefficient production from progenitor B cells without any corresponding decreases in the other isotypes. The clinical course and prognosis is dependent upon the severity of the selective deficiency and associated morbidity.
synonyms: selective Immunoglobulin isotype deficiency

label: selective IgG immunodeficiency
definition: A broad classification of dysgammaglobulinemias characterized by low or undetectable serum levels of immunoglobulin class G (IgG). Deficiencies of IgG present variably according to subclass. IgG deficiencies are typically relative among subclasses and not absolute. Thus even with a given selective IgG subclass deficiency, total IgG levels may still fall within normal range. The clinical course and prognosis is dependent upon the severity of the deficiency and associated morbidity.
synonyms: selective IgG immunodeficiency

label: selective IgA deficiency disease
definition: A dysgammaglobulinemia characterized by low or undetectable serum levels of immunoglobulin class A (IgA). It is the most common primary antibody deficiency. It may be inherited or the reversible sequela of infection or certain drugs. It may be caused by decreased or inefficient class-switching from progenitor B cells without any corresponding decreases in the other isotypes. Though affected persons may be asymptomatic, low levels of IgA will reduce the immune system's ability to combat infection where IgA is normally secreted, at mucosal surfaces. Selective IgA deficiency is seen in greater proportion among patients with autoimmune disorders.
synonyms: IgA deficiency, selective IgA immunodeficiency, gamma-A-globulin deficiency, selective immunoglobulin A deficiency, SIgAD, immunoglobulin A deficiency

label: segmental dystonia
definition: A dystonia that affects two or more adjacent parts of the body.

label: secretory diarrhea
definition: Watery voluminous diarrhea resulting from an imbalance between ion and water secretion and absorption.

label: secondary polycythemia
definition: Secondary polycythemia is an elevated absolute red blood cell mass caused by enhanced stimulation of red blood cell production by an otherwise normal erythroid lineage that may be congenital or acquired (congenital secondary polycythemia and acquired secondary polycythemia).
synonyms: secondary erythrocytosis, secondary polycythemia
subsets: mondo:gard_rare, mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders, mondo:otar, mondo:rare, mondo:disease_grouping, mondo:nord_rare

label: secondary neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm that arises from a pre-existing lower grade lesion, or as a result of a primary lesion that has spread to secondary sites, or due to a complication of a cancer treatment.
synonyms: secondary tumour, secondary tumor, secondary neoplasm

label: secondary malignant neoplasm
definition: A malignant neoplasm that arises from a pre-existing lower grade lesion, or as a result of a primary lesion that has spread to secondary sites, or due to a complication of a cancer treatment.
synonyms: secondary malignant neoplasm, secondary cancer, secondary malignancy

label: secondary hypertension
definition: High blood pressure caused by an underlying medical condition.

label: secondary hyperparathyroidism
definition: Overproduction of parathyroid hormone in response to influence external to the parathyroid glands.
synonyms: secondary hyperparathyroidism (disease), secondary hyperparathyroidism

label: secondary hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis
definition: Hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis due to infections, autoimmune disorders, or underlying malignancies. Signs and symptoms include fever, lymphadenopathy, hepatomegaly, splenomegaly, and pancytopenia.
synonyms: reactive hemophagocytic syndrome, acquired hemophagocytic syndrome, acquired hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis

label: secondary carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from a pre-existing lower grade epithelial lesion, or as a result of a primary carcinoma that has spread to secondary sites, or due to a complication of a cancer treatment.
synonyms: secondary carcinoma

label: secondary avascular necrosis
synonyms: secondary AVN

label: secondary antiphospholipid syndrome
definition: An antiphospholipid syndrome that occurs alongside another autoimmune disorder.

label: secondary Parkinson disease
definition: A condition with a clinical picture similar to that of Parkinson disease, but which is caused by external factors, including medication.
synonyms: symptomatic parkinsonism, secondary parkinsonism, unspecified, disorder presenting primarily with parkinsonism, secondary Parkinsonism, secondary parkinsonism (disorder) [ambiguous]

label: second-degree atrioventricular block
definition: Intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction to the ventricles.
synonyms: second-degree heart block, AV block second degree, atrioventricular block second degree, second degree AV block, atrioventricular block, second degree, second degree atrioventricular block

label: seborrheic keratosis
definition: A common benign skin neoplasm usually affecting older individuals. The lesions usually are multiple and arise in the face, chest, and shoulders. They appear as black or brown, slightly elevated skin lesions.
synonyms: keratosis, seborrheic, somatic, keratosis Seborrheica, basal cell papilloma

label: seborrheic dermatitis
definition: A chronic, inflammatory skin disorder that affects the scalp, central face and skin folds; it is characterized by scaling and itching.
synonyms: cradle Cap, seborrheic dermatitis, Seborrhoeic dermatitis, seborrhea, seborrheic dermatitis (disease), Seborrhoeic eczema, skin seborrheic, seborrheic eczema

label: sebaceous gland neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from the sebaceous glands. Representative examples include sebaceous adenoma and sebaceous carcinoma.
synonyms: tumor of sebaceous gland, sebaceous gland neoplasm, tumour of sebaceous gland, sebaceous tumor, sebaceous gland tumor, sebaceous neoplasm, sebaceous gland tumour, sebaceous gland neoplasm (disease), neoplasm of sebaceous gland, sebaceous tumour

label: sebaceous gland disorder
definition: A disease involving the sebaceous gland.
synonyms: sebaceous gland disease or disorder, disease or disorder of sebaceous gland, disorder of sebaceous gland, sebaceous gland disease, disease of sebaceous gland

label: sebaceous gland cancer
definition: A cancer that involves the sebaceous gland.
synonyms: malignant tumor of sebaceous gland, cancer of sebaceous gland, malignant sebaceous tumour, malignant sebaceous gland tumor, malignant neoplasm of the sebaceous gland, malignant sebaceous tumor, malignant sebaceous gland neoplasm, malignant neoplasm of sebaceous gland, malignant tumour of sebaceous gland, malignant sebaceous neoplasm, malignant sebaceous gland tumour, malignant tumor of the sebaceous gland, malignant tumour of the sebaceous gland

label: sebaceous adenocarcinoma
definition: An adenocarcinoma with sebaceous differentiation. It presents as a painless mass and it may be multifocal. It grows in the ocular adnexae and in the skin of head and neck, trunk, genitals, and extremities. It is characterized by the presence of malignant cells with multivesicular and clear cytoplasm. It may recur and metastasize.
synonyms: adenocarcinoma, sebaceous, malignant, sebaceous gland carcinoma, sebaceous cancer, sebaceous carcinoma, carcinoma of sebaceous gland, carcinoma of the sebaceous gland, adenocarcinoma of the sebaceous gland, sebaceous gland adenocarcinoma

label: scrotum squamous cell carcinoma
definition: A rare squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the scrotum. It has been associated with exposure to environmental and industrial carcinogens. The prognosis depends on the extent of lymph node involvement.
synonyms: scrotal squamous cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma of the scrotum, scrotum squamous cell carcinoma

label: scrotum neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the scrotum.
synonyms: scrotum tumor, tumor of scrotum, scrotal neoplasm, scrotal tumor, scrotal tumour, tumor of the scrotum, neoplasm of the scrotum, tumour of the scrotum, scrotal Ca, scrotum tumour, scrotum neoplasm (disease), tumour of scrotum, neoplasm of scrotum

label: scrotum cancer
definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm affecting the scrotum.
synonyms: scrotum cancer, malignant scrotum neoplasm, cancer of scrotum, malignant scrotal neoplasm, malignant tumour of scrotum, malignant neoplasm of the scrotum, malignant tumor of the scrotum, malignant tumour of the scrotum, malignant neoplasm of scrotum, malignant tumor of scrotum, malignant scrotal tumour, malignant scrotal tumor

label: scrotal hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma arising from the skin of the scrotum.
synonyms: scrotum hemangioma, scrotal hemangioma, hemangioma of the scrotum, scrotal angioma, hemangioma of scrotum, angioma of the scrotum, angioma of scrotum

label: scrotal disorder
definition: A disease or disorder that involves the scrotum.
synonyms: disease of scrotum, disease or disorder of scrotum, disorder of scrotum, scrotum disease or disorder, scrotum disease

label: scrotal carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from epithelial cells of the scrotum.
synonyms: carcinoma of the scrotum, scrotum carcinoma, carcinoma of scrotum

label: scoliosis
definition: A congenital or acquired spinal deformity characterized by lateral curvature of the spine.

label: sclerosing cholangitis
definition: A chronic, autoimmune inflammatory liver disorder characterized by narrowing and scarring of the lumen of the bile ducts. It is often seen in patients with ulcerative colitis. Signs and symptoms include jaundice, fatigue, and malabsorption. It may lead to cirrhosis and liver failure.
synonyms: sclerosing cholangitis, fibrosing cholangitis, primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC), Primary sclerosing cholangitis, sclerosing cholangitis (disease)

label: scleritis
definition: Inflammation of the sclera.
synonyms: scleritis, scleritis (disease)

label: scleral disorder
definition: A disorder affecting the sclera. Examples include inflammatory processes (e.g., scleritis and episcleritis), and degenerative processes. Primary tumors of the sclera are extremely rare.
synonyms: sclera disease, disease of sclera, sclera disease or disorder, scleral disorder, sclera disorder, disorder of sclera, disease or disorder of sclera

label: sciatica
definition: A condition characterized by pain radiating from the back into the buttock and posterior/lateral aspects of the leg. Sciatica may be a manifestation of sciatic neuropathy; radiculopathy (involving the spinal nerve roots; L4, L5, S1, or S2, often associated with intervertebral disk displacement); or lesions of the cauda equina.

label: sciatic neuropathy
definition: Disease or damage involving the SCIATIC NERVE, which divides into the PERONEAL NERVE and TIBIAL NERVE (see also PERONEAL NEUROPATHIES and TIBIAL NEUROPATHY). Clinical manifestations may include SCIATICA or pain localized to the hip, PARESIS or PARALYSIS of posterior thigh muscles and muscles innervated by the peroneal and tibial nerves, and sensory loss involving the lateral and posterior thigh, posterior and lateral leg, and sole of the foot. The sciatic nerve may be affected by trauma; ISCHEMIA; COLLAGEN DISEASES; and other conditions. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, p1363)

label: schizophrenia
definition: A major psychotic disorder characterized by abnormalities in the perception or expression of reality. It affects the cognitive and psychomotor functions. Common clinical signs and symptoms include delusions, hallucinations, disorganized thinking, and retreat from reality.
synonyms: schizophrenia-1, schizophrenia (disease), schizophrenia

label: scabies
definition: A contagious skin infection that is caused by the burrowing parasitic mite, Sarcoptes scabiei, and is characterized by intense itching and small, raised red spots in the area of the mite burrows.
synonyms: infestation by Sarcoptes scabiei, sarcoptic itch, Sarcoptes scabiei disease or disorder, Sarcoptes scabiei infectious disease, Sarcoptes scabiei caused disease or disorder, infestation by Sarcoptes scabiei var hominis

label: sarcomatosis
definition: The occurrence of several sarcomas in different anatomic locations.
synonyms: sarcomatosis NOS (morphologic abnormality), sarcomatosis, sarcomatosis (morphologic abnormality)

label: sarcomatoid transitional cell carcinoma
definition: A poorly differentiated transitional cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of malignant cells with spindle cell morphologic features.
synonyms: transitional cell carcinoma, sarcomatoid, transitional cell spindle cell carcinoma, transitional spindle cell carcinoma, sarcomatoid transitional cell carcinoma

label: sarcomatoid squamous cell carcinoma
definition: A poorly differentiated squamous cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of malignant cells with spindle cell features.
synonyms: squamous cell carcinoma, sarcomatoid, squamous cell carcinoma, spindle cell, epidermoid spindle cell carcinoma, squamous cell spindle cell carcinoma, spindle cell (sarcomatoid) squamous cell carcinoma, sarcomatoid squamous cell carcinoma

label: sarcomatoid carcinoma
definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm characterized by the presence of spindle cells and anaplastic morphologic features. Giant cells and a sarcomatous component may also be present.
synonyms: spindle cell carcinoma, sarcomatoid carcinoma, pseudosarcomatous carcinoma, carcinoma, spindle cell, malignant, spindle cell carcinoma (morphologic abnormality)

label: sarcoma with BCOR genetic alterations
definition: A small cell sarcoma that is characterized by the presence of small round or elongated malignant cells with a small amount of cytoplasm and the presence of BCOR genetic alterations.

label: sarcoma
definition: A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm of the soft tissue or bone. It arises from muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, bone, cartilage, and blood vessels. Sarcomas occur in both children and adults. The prognosis depends largely on the degree of differentiation (grade) of the neoplasm. Representative subtypes are liposarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, osteosarcoma, and chondrosarcoma.
synonyms: sarcoma, malignant, sarcoma of the soft tissue and bone, mesenchymal tumor, malignant, sarcoma, sarcoma of soft tissue and bone

label: sarcoglycanopathy
definition: Deficiencies or mutations in the genes for the sarcoglycan complex subunits. A variety of phenotypes are associated with these mutations including a subgroup of autosomal recessive limb girdle muscular dystrophies, cardiomyopathies, and respiratory deficiency.
synonyms: qualitative or quantitative defects of sarcoglycan
subsets: mondo:disease_grouping, mondo:rare, mondo:gard_rare, mondo:otar, mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders, mondo:nord_rare

label: salpingo-oophoritis
synonyms: tubo-ovarian abscess, Tubo-ovarian inflammatory disease, tubo-ovarian abscess (disorder), salpingitis/oophoritis, tubo ovarian abscess

label: salpingitis
definition: Acute or chronic inflammation of the fallopian tube. It is most often caused by Neisseria gonorrhoeae and Chlamydia trachomatis infections. The infections usually originate in the vagina and ascend to the fallopian tube. Symptoms include abdominal, pelvic, and lower back pain, pain during ovulation and sexual intercourse, fever, nausea, and vomiting. Complications include infertility and ectopic pregnancy.
synonyms: inflammation of fallopian tube, fallopian tube inflammation

label: salmonellosis
definition: Infections with bacteria of the genus salmonella.
synonyms: rare form of salmonellosis, Salmonella infection

label: salivary gland mucoepidermoid carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from the salivary glands. It is the most common primary carcinoma of the salivary glands and usually presents as a firm and painless mass. It is characterized by the presence of epidermoid cells, mucus producing cells, and cells of intermediate type. The majority of cases have a favorable outcome.
synonyms: mucoepidermoid carcinoma of salivary gland, saliva-secreting gland mucoepidermoid carcinoma, mucoepidermoid carcinoma of the salivary gland, salivary gland mucoepidermoid carcinoma

label: salivary gland disorder
definition: A disease involving the saliva-secreting gland.
synonyms: disorder of saliva-secreting gland, salivary gland disorder, disease of saliva-secreting gland, saliva-secreting gland disease, disease or disorder of saliva-secreting gland, salivary gland disease, saliva-secreting gland disease or disorder

label: salivary gland carcinoma ex pleomorphic adenoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from a pleomorphic adenoma in the salivary glands. It usually originates in the parotid gland. Patients usually present with a history of a long-standing tumor mass which grew rapidly in the past few months. Patients with non-invasive or minimally invasive carcinoma have an excellent prognosis. In cases where there is invasion of the surrounding tissues, the clinical course is aggressive.
synonyms: saliva-secreting gland carcinoma ex pleomorphic adenoma, salivary gland carcinoma ex pleomorphic adenoma

label: salivary gland carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from the major or minor salivary glands. Representative examples include carcinoma ex pleomorphic adenoma, adenocarcinoma, adenoid cystic carcinoma, and mucoepidermoid carcinoma.
synonyms: carcinoma of the salivary gland, saliva-secreting gland carcinoma, salivary gland carcinoma, carcinoma of saliva-secreting gland, carcinoma of salivary gland

label: salivary gland cancer
definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the major or minor salivary glands. Representative examples include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.
synonyms: cancer of the salivary gland, malignant salivary gland tumour, malignant tumor of salivary gland, salivary gland cancer, malignant tumour of salivary gland, malignant neoplasm of salivary gland duct, malignant tumour of the salivary gland, malignant salivary gland neoplasm, cancer of salivary gland, malignant neoplasm of saliva-secreting gland, malignant tumor of the salivary gland, malignant neoplasm of salivary gland, malignant neoplasm of the salivary gland, saliva-secreting gland cancer, malignant salivary gland tumor, malignant saliva-secreting gland neoplasm, cancer of saliva-secreting gland

label: salivary gland adenoid cystic carcinoma
definition: An adenoid cystic carcinoma arising from the salivary gland. It is characterized by the presence of epithelial and myoepithelial cells forming tubular, cribriform, and solid patterns. It usually presents as a slow growing mass. Patients may experience pain because of the tumor propensity for perineural invasion. The tumor may follow an aggressive clinical course with recurrences and mestastases to distant sites including lungs, bones, brain, and liver.
synonyms: adenoid cystic carcinoma of the salivary gland, cylindroma (morphologic abnormality), saliva-secreting gland adenoid cystic carcinoma, salivary gland adenoid cystic carcinoma, adenoid cystic carcinoma of salivary gland, salivary gland adenoid cystic cancer

label: saccular spinal dysraphism with a stalk to the dome
definition: A rare spinal dysraphism characterized by a meningocele, containing a stalk, that is attached to the inner surface of the meningocele. The stalk can be posteriorly fibroneural (saccular limited dorsal myeloschisis) or the spinal cord itself (myelic limited dorsal malformation).

label: rubella
definition: A viral infection caused by the rubella virus. It is initially manifested with flu-like symptoms that last one or two days, followed by the development of a characteristic red rash which lasts from one to five days. The rash first appears in the neck and face. It subsequently spreads to the rest of the body.
synonyms: Rubella virus infectious disease, three-Day Measles, german measles, Rubella virus disease or disorder, Rubella virus caused disease or disorder, Rubella infection

label: round cell sarcoma with EWSR1-non-ETS fusion
definition: A small cell sarcoma that is characterized by the presence of EWSR1 or FUS fusions involving partners unrelated to the ETS gene family.

label: roseolovirus infectious disease
definition: Infection with roseolovirus, the most common in humans being exanthema subitum, a benign disease of infants and young children.
synonyms: Roseolovirus disease or disorder, Roseolovirus infectious disease, Roseolovirus caused disease or disorder

label: rosacea
definition: A chronic erythematous skin disorder that affects the face. It is characterized by the development of redness in the cheeks, nose, and/or forehead and telangiectasia. Sometimes, the erythematous changes may involve the eyelids.
synonyms: acne rosacea, acne, erythematosa, acne roscea

label: rippling muscle disease
definition: A benign myopathy with symptoms and signs of muscular hyperexcitability. The typical finding is electrically silent muscle contractions provoked by mechanical stimuli and stretch

label: ring chromosome disorder
definition: Chromosomal disorder in which the chromosomal anomaly consists of the presence of a ring chromosome. A ring chromosome is a chromosome whose arms have fused together to form a ring, often with the loss of the ends of the chromosome.
synonyms: supernumerary circular chromosome

label: rigid spine syndrome
definition: Rigid spine syndrome (RSS) is a slowly progressive childhood-onset congenital muscular dystrophy characterized by contractures of the spinal extensor muscles associated with abnormal posture (limitation of neck and trunk flexure), progressive scoliosis of the spine, early marked cervico-axial muscle weakness with relatively preserved strength and function of the extremities and progressive respiratory insufficiency.
synonyms: rigid spine congenital muscular dystrophy
subsets: mondo:otar, mondo:gard_rare, mondo:nord_rare, mondo:orphanet_rare, mondo:ordo_disorder, mondo:rare

label: rigid spine muscular dystrophy 1
definition: An inherited muscular dystrophy caused by mutations in the SEPN1 gene. It is characterized by severe limitation in flexion of the dorsolumbar and cervical spine, due to contracture of the spinal extensors. It leads to loss of movement of the spine and the thoracic cage.
synonyms: muscular dystrophy, rigid spine, 1, severe classic form multicore myopathy, desmin-related myopathy with Mallory bodies, RSS, multiminicore disease, severe classic form, rigid spine syndrome caused by mutation in SELENON, rigid spine muscular dystrophy 1, MDRS1, severe classic form multiminicore disease, SELENON rigid spine syndrome, Eichsfeld type congenital muscular dystrophy, minicore myopathy, severe classic form, rigid spine muscular dystrophy type 1, myopathy, SEPN1-related, multicore myopathy, severe classic form, muscular dystrophy, congenital, Eichsfeld type, RSMD1, muscular dystrophy, congenital, merosin-positive, with early spine rigidity, congenital merosin-positive muscular dystrophy with early spine rigidity, severe classic form minicore myopathy

label: rickets
definition: Bone softening and weakening usually caused by deficiency or impaired metabolism of vitamin D. Deficiency of calcium, magnesium, or phosphorus may also cause rickets. It predominantly affects children who suffer from severe malnutrition. It manifests with bone pain, fractures, muscle weakness, and skeletal deformities.
synonyms: vitamin D hydroxylation-deficient rickets, rickets (disease), rickets, rachitis

label: rhinitis
definition: An inflammation of the mucous membrane lining the nose, usually associated with nasal discharge.
synonyms: inflammation of nasal cavity mucosa, nasal cavity mucosa inflammation

label: rheumatoid arthritis
definition: A chronic, systemic autoimmune disorder characterized by inflammation in the synovial membranes and articular surfaces. It manifests primarily as a symmetric, erosive polyarthritis that spares the axial skeleton and is typically associated with the presence in the serum of rheumatoid factor.
synonyms: arthritis or polyarthritis, rheumatic, rheumatoid arthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, progression of, arthritis, rheumatoid, autoimmune arthritis, RA

label: rheumatic pericarditis
synonyms: rheumatic pericarditis

label: rheumatic heart disease
definition: An autoinflammatory condition following an infection with Group A Beta Hemolytic Streptococcus (GABHS), in which the heart is attacked by antibodies formed in reaction to a recent GABHS infection. Chief anatomic changes of the valve include leaflet thickening, commissural fusion, and shortening and thickening of the tendinous cords, all of which can result in valvular dysfunction.
synonyms: RHD, heart disease, rheumatic, disease, rheumatic heart, rheumatic carditis

label: rheumatic disorder
definition: Inflammatory and degenerative diseases of connective tissue structures, such as arthritis.
synonyms: rheumatic disease, rheumatologic disorder

label: rhabdomyoma
definition: A benign mesenchymal tumor arising from skeletal or cardiac muscle.
synonyms: Rhabdomyomatous neoplasm, rhabdomyoma, benign, rhabdomyoma

label: rhabdoid meningioma
definition: A WHO grade III meningioma characterized by the predominant presence of rhabdoid cells forming sheets.
synonyms: papillary meningioma (morphologic abnormality), rhabdoid meningioma, meningioma, rhabdoid, meningioma, rhabdoid (morphologic abnormality)

label: retroperitoneum carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from epithelial cells of the retroperitoneal space.
synonyms: carcinoma of the retroperitoneum, carcinoma of retroperitoneum, retroperitoneal carcinoma, retroperitoneal space carcinoma, carcinoma of retroperitoneal space

label: retroperitoneal sarcoma
definition: A sarcoma involving a retroperitoneal space.
synonyms: retroperitoneal space sarcoma, sarcoma of retroperitoneal space, retroperitoneal sarcoma

label: retroperitoneal neuroblastoma
definition: A neuroblastoma that involves the retroperitoneal space.
synonyms: neuroblastoma of retroperitoneal space, retroperitoneal space neuroblastoma

label: retroperitoneal neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the retroperitoneum.
synonyms: retroperitoneal space tumor, tumor of retroperitoneal space, retroperitoneal space tumour, retroperitoneal neoplasm, neoplasm of retroperitoneal space, retroperitoneal space neoplasm, tumour of retroperitoneal space

label: retroperitoneal cancer
definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the retroperitoneum. The vast majority of cases are carcinomas, lymphomas, or sarcomas.
synonyms: malignant retroperitoneal space neoplasm, malignant neoplasm of retroperitoneal space, malignant tumor of peritoneum and retroperitoneum, retroperitoneal space cancer, cancer of retroperitoneal space, malignant retroperitoneal neoplasm, malignant tumour of peritoneum and retroperitoneum, malignant neoplasm of retroperitoneum and peritoneum

label: retrocochlear disease
definition: Pathological processes involving the vestibulocochlear nerve; brainstem; or central nervous system. When hearing loss is due to retrocochlear pathology, it is called retrocochlear hearing loss.

label: retinoschisis
definition: An inherited or acquired disorder characterized by splitting of the retina into two layers. It results in loss of vision.

label: retinitis
definition: Inflammation of the retina.
synonyms: inflammation of retina, retina inflammation

label: retinal vein occlusion
definition: An occlusion of the retinal vein.
synonyms: occlusion, of retinal vein, retinal vein occlusion

label: retinal vascular occlusion
definition: An occlusion of the retinal vasculature.
synonyms: retinal vascular occlusion, unspecified, retinal vascular occlusion

label: retinal vascular disorder
definition: Retinal damage resulting from diminished blood flow/oxygenation due to abnormalities of the retinal vessels. Causes include hypertension, diabetes, thrombosis, embolism, and hemorrhage.
synonyms: retinal vascular disorder, retina circulation disorder

label: retinal nerve fiber layer disorder
definition: A disease that involves the nerve fiber layer of retina.
synonyms: disease of nerve fiber layer of retina, nerve fiber layer of retina disease, disorder of nerve fibre layer of retina, retinal nerve fibre bundle deficiency, nerve fibre layer of retina disease or disorder, disease of nerve fibre layer of retina, nerve fiber layer of retina disease or disorder, retinal nerve fibre bundle defects, disease or disorder of nerve fibre layer of retina, retinal nerve fiber bundle defects, retinal nerve fiber bundle deficiency, disorder of nerve fiber layer of retina, disease or disorder of nerve fiber layer of retina, nerve fibre layer of retina disease

label: retinal dystrophies primarily involving Bruch's membrane
definition: A retinal dystrophy with etiology arising from Bruch's membrane, the site of drusen generation.
synonyms: Bruch's membrane inherited retinal dystrophy, inherited retinal dystrophy of Bruch's membrane, retinal dystrophies primarily involving Bruch membrane

label: retinal drusen
definition: Colloid or hyaline bodies lying beneath the retinal pigment epithelium. They may occur either secondary to changes in the choroid that affect the pigment epithelium or as an autosomal dominant disorder of the retinal pigment epithelium.

label: retinal disorder
definition: Any disease or disorder of the retina.
synonyms: retina eye disease, retinopathy, eye disease of retina

label: retinal detachment
definition: An eye emergency condition which may lead to blindness if left untreated. It is characterized by the separation of the inner retina layers from the underlying pigment epithelium. Causes include trauma, advanced diabetes mellitus, high myopia, and choroid tumors. Symptoms include sudden appearance of floaters, sudden light flushes, and blurred vision.
synonyms: retina, detached, retinal detachment, detached retina

label: retinal degeneration
definition: Degeneration of the retina.
synonyms: retina, Degeneration Of, retina degeneration, degeneration of retina

label: retinal cell neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm arising from the neural retina. This category includes retinoblastoma and retinocytoma.
synonyms: retinal cell tumour, retinal neural cell neoplasm, retinal cell tumor, retinal cell neoplasm

label: retinal cell cancer
synonyms: cancer of retinal cell, malignant retinal cell neoplasm, retinal cell cancer, malignant neoplasm of retinal cell

label: retinal cancer
definition: A malignant neoplasm involving the retina.
synonyms: retina cancer, malignant retinal tumor, malignant retina neoplasm, malignant retina tumour, cancer of retina, malignant tumour of retina, malignant tumour of the retina, malignant tumor of retina, malignant retinal neoplasm, malignant neoplasm of the retina, malignant retina tumor, malignant tumor of the retina, malignant neoplasm of retina, malignant retinal tumour

label: retinal artery occlusion
definition: An occlusion of the retinal artery.

label: retina neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm (disease) that involves the retina.
synonyms: neoplasm of the retina, tumor of the retina, retina tumor, retina neoplasm (disease), retinal tumour, retina tumour, neoplasm of retina, retinal neoplasm, tumor of retina, retinal tumor, tumour of retina, tumour of the retina

label: reticulate pigment disorder
synonyms: reticulate pigment disorders

label: rete testis neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the rete testis. Representative examples include adenoma and adenocarcinoma.
synonyms: rete testis neoplasm, tumour of rete testis, rete testis tumor, rete testis tumour, rete testis neoplasm (disease), tumor of rete testis, neoplasm of rete testis

label: rete ovarii neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from the rete ovarii which is located in the ovarian hilus. It includes adenoma, cystadenoma, cystadenofibroma, and adenocarcinoma.
synonyms: rete ovarii tumor, tumour of rete ovarii, rete ovarii neoplasm (disease), neoplasm of rete ovarii, rete ovarii tumour, tumor of rete ovarii

label: rete ovarii adenoma
definition: An adenoma that arises from the rete ovarii. It is composed of elongated tubules. The clinical course is benign.
synonyms: adenoma, rete ovarii, benign, rete ovarii adenoma

label: restrictive cardiomyopathy
definition: A type of heart disorder referring to the inability of the ventricles to fill with blood because the myocardium (heart muscle) stiffens and looses its flexibility. Causes include replacement of the myocardium with scar tissue, abnormal cellular infiltration of the myocardium, or deposition of a substance (e.g., amyloid) in the myocardium.
synonyms: primary restrictive cardiomyopathy, restrictive cardiomyopathy, cardiomyopathy, constrictive
subsets: mondo:rare, mondo:nord_rare, mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders, mondo:disease_grouping, mondo:otar, mondo:gard_rare

label: respirovirus infectious disease
definition: Infections with viruses of the genus respirovirus, family paramyxoviridae. Host cell infection occurs by adsorption, via hemagglutinin, to the cell surface.

label: respiratory tract neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm involving the respiratory tract.
synonyms: respiratory tract neoplasm, respiratory system neoplasm, respiratory tract tumor, neoplasm, respiratory tract, tumour of respiratory tract, tumor of respiratory tract, neoplasm of respiratory tract, tract neoplasm, respiratory, tumour of the respiratory tract, tract neoplasms, respiratory, neoplasms, respiratory tract, neoplasm of the respiratory tract, respiratory tract tumour, tumor of the respiratory tract

label: respiratory tract infectious disorder
definition: Invasion of the host RESPIRATORY SYSTEM by microorganisms, usually leading to pathological processes or diseases.

label: respiratory system disorder
definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the respiratory system. Representative examples include pneumonia, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, pulmonary failure, lung adenoma, lung carcinoma, and tracheal carcinoma.
synonyms: respiratory system disease, respiratory disease, disease of respiratory system, respiratory disorder, respiratory system disorder, respiratory system disease or disorder, disorder of respiratory system, disease or disorder of respiratory system

label: respiratory system cancer
definition: A malignant neoplasm involving the respiratory system
synonyms: malignant neoplasm of respiratory system, respiratory system cancer, cancer of respiratory system, malignant respiratory system neoplasm

label: respiratory system benign neoplasm
definition: A benign neoplasm that involves the respiratory system.
synonyms: respiratory system benign neoplasm

label: respiratory syncytial virus infectious disease
definition: Infection with the respiratory syncytial virus, an RNA virus of the genus Pneumovirus, in the family Paramyxoviridae, which is characterized by the formation of syncytia in tissue culture. It causes minor respiratory infection with rhinitis and cough in adults, but is capable of causing severe bronchitis and bronchopneumonia in young children.
synonyms: respiratory syncytial virus infection, Human respiratory syncytial virus infection

label: respiratory failure
definition: The significant impairment of gas exchange within the lungs resulting in hypoxia, hypercarbia, or both, to the extent that organ tissue perfusion is severely compromised. Causes include chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, asthma, emphysema, acute respiratory distress syndrome, pneumonia, pulmonary edema, pneumothorax, and congestive heart failure. Treatment requires intubation and mechanical ventilation until the time the lungs recover sufficient function.
synonyms: failure, respiratory, respiratory failure, respiratory insufficiency/failure

label: reproductive system neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm affecting the male and female reproductive system.
synonyms: reproductive system tumour, tumor of reproductive system, tumor of the reproductive system, reproductive neoplasm, neoplasm of the reproductive system, tumour of the reproductive system, reproductive system neoplasm (disease), reproductive system neoplasm, reproductive tumour, reproductive tumor, neoplasm of reproductive system, reproductive system tumor, tumour of reproductive system

label: reproductive system disorder
definition: A disease involving the reproductive system.
synonyms: reproductive system disease, genital system disease, disease of reproductive system, genital disorders, reproductive disease, disease or disorder of reproductive system, reproductive system disorder, disorder of reproductive system, reproductive system disease or disorder

label: reproductive system cancer
definition: A malignant neoplasm involving the reproductive organ
synonyms: malignant reproductive organ neoplasm, malignant neoplasm of reproductive system, malignant neoplasm of reproductive organ, cancer of reproductive system, reproductive organ cancer, malignant reproductive system neoplasm, reproductive system cancer, cancer of reproductive organ

label: renal tubule disorder
definition: A disease that involves the renal tubule.
synonyms: renal tubular disorder, disease of renal tubule, renal tubule disease or disorder, renal tubule disease, disease or disorder of renal tubule, renal tubular disease, disorder of renal tubule

label: renal tubular transport disease
definition: Genetic defects in the selective or non-selective transport functions of the kidney tubules.
synonyms: renal absorption disease, inborn renal tubular transport disorder, disorder of renal absorption

label: renal tubular acidosis
definition: A group of genetic disorders of the kidney tubules characterized by the accumulation of metabolically produced acids with elevated plasma chloride, hyperchloremic metabolic acidosis. Defective renal acidification of urine (proximal tubules) or low renal acid excretion (distal tubules) can lead to complications such as hypokalemia, hypercalcinuria with nephrolithiasis and nephrocalcinosis, and rickets.

label: renal pelvis/ureter urothelial carcinoma
definition: A transitional cell carcinoma that arises from the renal pelvis and ureter.
synonyms: renal pelvis and ureter transitional cell carcinoma, transitional cell cancer of the renal pelvis and ureter, renal pelvis and ureter urothelial carcinoma, TCC of the renal pelvis and ureter, TCC of renal pelvis and ureter, renal pelvis and ureter transitional cell cancer, renal pelvis and ureter TCC, transitional cell carcinoma of renal pelvis and ureter, transitional cell cancer of renal pelvis and ureter, urothelial carcinoma of the renal pelvis and ureter

label: renal pelvis urothelial papilloma
definition: A benign neoplasm of the renal pelvis that involves the transitional epithelium projecting above the surrounding epithelial surface and consisting of villous or arborescent outgrowths of fibrovascular stroma.
synonyms: renal pelvis urothelial papilloma

label: renal pelvis urothelial carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from the transitional epithelium of the renal pelvis. It is associated with tobacco use and usually presents with gross or microscopic hematuria. Urothelial carcinomas of the renal pelvis are usually of higher grade and higher stage compared to bladder urothelial carcinomas.
synonyms: renal pelvis urothelial cancer, renal pelvis transitional cell carcinoma, transitional cell carcinoma of the renal pelvis, kidney renal pelvis urothelial cancer, transitional cell carcinoma of renal pelvis, urothelial cell carcinoma of renal pelvis, renal pelvis urothelial carcinoma, urothelial cell carcinoma of the renal pelvis

label: renal pelvis papillary tumor
definition: A papillary tumor originating in the renal pelvis.
synonyms: papillary tumor of renal pelvis, renal pelvis papillary urothelial neoplasm, renal pelvis papillary tumor, papillary tumor of the renal pelvis, papillary tumour of the renal pelvis, papillary tumour of renal pelvis, papillary neoplasm of renal pelvis, papillary neoplasm of the renal pelvis

label: renal pelvis neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm (disease) that involves the renal pelvis.
synonyms: renal pelvis tumor, kidney pelvis tumor, kidney pelvis tumour, tumour of the kidney pelvis, neoplasm of renal pelvis, renal pelvis neoplasm, tumor of renal pelvis, tumour of kidney pelvis, tumor of the renal pelvis, tumor of kidney pelvis, neoplasm of the kidney pelvis, tumour of renal pelvis, neoplasm of kidney pelvis, tumour of the renal pelvis, neoplasm of the renal pelvis, kidney pelvis neoplasm, renal pelvis neoplasm (disease), tumor of the kidney pelvis, renal pelvis tumour

label: renal pelvis carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma arising in the renal pelvis. The majority of renal pelvis carcinomas are transitional cell and less frequently squamous cell carcinomas.
synonyms: kidney renal pelvis cancer, kidney pelvis carcinoma, carcinoma of kidney pelvis, carcinoma of the kidney pelvis, renal pelvis carcinoma, carcinoma of renal pelvis, carcinoma of the renal pelvis

label: renal hypertension
definition: Hypertension caused by the kidney's hormonal response to narrowing or occlusion of the renal arteries.

label: renal cell carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from glandular epithelial cells of the kidney
synonyms: renal cell carcinoma, renal cell carcinoma (disease), RCC, hypernephroma
subsets: mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders, mondo:disease_grouping, mondo:nord_rare, mondo:rare, mondo:otar, mondo:gard_rare

label: renal cell adenocarcinoma
definition: A carcinoma arising from the renal parenchyma. There is a strong correlation between cigarette smoking and the development of renal cell carcinoma. The clinical presentation includes : hematuria, flank pain and a palpable lumbar mass. A high percentage of renal cell carcinomas are diagnosed when an ultrasound is performed for other purposes. Radical nephrectomy is the standard intervention procedure. Renal cell carcinoma is generally considered to be resistant to radiation treatment and chemotherapy.
synonyms: renal cell carcinoma, stage unspecified, renal cell cancer, RCC, renal cell adenocarcinoma, carcinoma, renal cell, malignant, adenocarcinoma of kidney, kidney adenocarcinoma, adenocarcinoma of the kidney

label: renal carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma arising from the epithelium of the renal parenchyma or the renal pelvis. The majority are renal cell carcinomas. Kidney carcinomas usually affect middle aged and elderly adults. Hematuria, abdominal pain, and a palpable mass are common symptoms.
synonyms: renal carcinoma, kidney carcinoma, carcinoma of kidney

label: renal artery disease
definition: A disease involving the renal artery.
synonyms: renal vascular disease, vascular disorder of kidney

label: renal adenoma
definition: An adenoma arising from the renal cortex.
synonyms: renal cell adenoma, adenoma, renal cell, benign, renal cell adenoma (morphologic abnormality), renal tubule adenoma, kidney adenoma, renal adenoma

label: refractory malignant neoplasm
definition: A malignant neoplasm that does not respond to treatment.
synonyms: resistant cancer, refractory malignant neoplasm, refractory cancer

label: refractory hematologic cancer
definition: A hematologic malignancy that is resistant to treatment.
synonyms: refractory hematologic cancer, refractory hematologic malignancy

label: refractive error
definition: A defect in the focusing of light on the retina as in astigmatism, myopia, or hyperopia.

label: reflex epilepsy
definition: Reflex epilepsy refers to epilepsies where recurrent seizures are provoked by a clearly defined extrinsic (most commonly) or intrinsic triggering stimuli such as flashing lights (photosensitive epilepsy), startling noises (startle epilepsy), urinating (micturition induced seizures), exposure to hot-water (hot water epilepsy), eating, reading, and thinking, while being associated with an enduring abnormal predisposition to have such seizures (thereby meeting the conceptual definition of epilepsy).
synonyms: epilepsy, sensory-induced

label: rectum sarcoma
definition: A malignant soft tissue neoplasm that arises from the rectum. Representative examples include angiosarcoma, Kaposi sarcoma, and leiomyosarcoma.
synonyms: rectal sarcoma, rectum sarcoma, sarcoma of the rectum, sarcoma of rectum

label: rectum rhabdomyosarcoma
definition: A malignant mesenchymal tumor with skeletal muscle differentiation affecting the rectum.
synonyms: rectum rhabdomyosarcoma (disease), rhabdomyosarcoma of rectum, rectal rhabdomyosarcoma, rhabdomyosarcoma of the rectum, rhabdomyosarcoma (disease) of rectum

label: rectum neuroendocrine neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the rectum. It includes well differentiated neuroendocrine tumors (low and intermediate grade) and poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinomas (high grade).
synonyms: neuroendocrine neoplasm of the rectum, neuroendocrine tumor of rectum, NET of the rectum, rectum neuroendocrine neoplasm, rectal neuroendocrine neoplasm, rectum NET, rectum neuroendocrine tumour, rectum neuroendocrine tumor, rectum neuroendocrine tumor, well differentiated, low or intermediate grade, rectal NET, neuroendocrine tumour of rectum, neuroendocrine neoplasm of rectum

label: rectum mucinous adenocarcinoma
definition: An invasive adenocarcinoma of the rectum characterized by the presence of pools of extracellular mucin. Malignant glandular epithelial cells are present in the mucin collections. Mucin constitutes more than 50% of the lesion.
synonyms: rectal colloidal adenocarcinoma, rectal colloid adenocarcinoma, colloid adenocarcinoma of rectum, mucinous adenocarcinoma of the rectum, colloidal adenocarcinoma of rectum, rectal mucinous adenocarcinoma, rectum mucinous adenocarcinoma, colloidal adenocarcinoma of the rectum, colloid adenocarcinoma of the rectum, mucinous adenocarcinoma of rectum

label: rectum malignant melanoma
definition: An aggressive malignant melanocytic neoplasm that arises from the rectum.
synonyms: melanoma of the rectum, rectum melanoma (disease), melanoma (disease) of rectum, rectum melanoma, rectal melanoma, melanoma of rectum, rectal malignant melanoma, malignant melanoma of rectum, malignant melanoma of the rectum

label: rectum lymphoma
definition: An extranodal lymphoma that arises from the rectum. The majority are B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphomas.
synonyms: lymphoma of the rectum, rectal lymphoma, primary rectal lymphoma, lymphoma of rectum, rectum lymphoma

label: rectum leiomyosarcoma
definition: An aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm that arises from the rectum. It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells.
synonyms: rectum leiomyosarcoma, leiomyosarcoma of rectum, rectal leiomyosarcoma, leiomyosarcoma of the rectum

label: rectum leiomyoma
definition: A well-circumscribed benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the rectum. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.
synonyms: rectum leiomyoma, rectal leiomyoma, leiomyoma of the rectum, leiomyoma of rectum

label: rectum adenoma
definition: An adenoma that arises from the rectum. The group of rectal adenomas includes tubular, villous, and tubulovillous adenomas, traditional serrated adenomas, sessile serrated adenomas/polyps, and familial adenomatous polyposis.
synonyms: rectum adenoma, adenoma of the rectum, rectal adenoma, adenoma of rectum

label: rectum adenocarcinoma
definition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the rectum. It is more frequently seen in populations with a Western type diet and in patients with a history of chronic inflammatory bowel disease. Signs and symptoms include intestinal bleeding, anemia, and change in bowel habits. According to the degree of cellular differentiation, rectal adenocarcinomas are divided into well, moderately, and poorly differentiated. Histologic variants include mucinous adenocarcinoma, signet ring cell carcinoma, medullary carcinoma, serrated adenocarcinoma, cribriform comedo-type adenocarcinoma, and micropapillary adenocarcinoma.
synonyms: rectum adenocarcinoma, adenocarcinoma - rectum, adenocarcinoma of rectum, adenocarcinoma of the rectum, rectal adenocarcinoma

label: rectosigmoid junction neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the rectosigmoid region. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include lipoma and leiomyoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma. Rectosigmoid adenomas always exhibit epithelial dysplasia and are considered premalignant neoplasms.
synonyms: neoplasm of rectosigmoid junction, tumour of the rectosigmoid junction, rectosigmoid junction tumor, rectosigmoid tumour, tumour of rectosigmoid junction, rectosigmoid junction tumour, rectosigmoid neoplasm, tumor of the rectosigmoid junction, tumor of rectosigmoid junction, rectosigmoid tumor, neoplasm of the rectosigmoid junction, rectosigmoid junction neoplasm (disease)

label: rectosigmoid junction cancer
definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the rectosigmoid area. Representative examples include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.
synonyms: malignant rectosigmoid junction neoplasm, malignant tumor of the rectosigmoid junction, malignant rectosigmoid tumour, cancer of rectosigmoid junction, malignant neoplasm of rectosigmoid junction, malignant tumor of rectosigmoid junction, malignant tumour of the rectosigmoid junction, rectosigmoid junction cancer, malignant tumour of rectosigmoid junction, malignant rectosigmoid neoplasm, malignant neoplasm of rectosigmoid, malignant rectosigmoid tumor, malignant neoplasm of the rectosigmoid junction

label: rectal neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the rectum. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include lipoma and leiomyoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma. Rectal adenomas always exhibit epithelial dysplasia and are considered premalignant neoplasms.
synonyms: rectal tumor, rectum neoplasm (disease), neoplasm of rectum, rectum neoplasm, neoplasm of the rectum, tumour of the rectum, tumor of the rectum, tumor of rectum, rectal tumour, rectum tumor, rectum tumour, rectal neoplasm, tumour of rectum

label: rectal disorder
definition: A disease that involves the rectum.
synonyms: disease or disorder of rectum, rectum disease or disorder, disease of rectum, disorder of rectum, rectal disorder, rectum disease

label: rectal carcinoma
definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the rectum and invades through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa. The vast majority are adenocarcinomas.
synonyms: carcinoma of rectum, carcinoma of the rectum, rectum carcinoma, rectal carcinoma

label: rectal cancer
definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the rectum. Representative examples include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.
synonyms: malignant rectal neoplasm, malignant tumour of the rectum, malignant neoplasm of rectum, malignant tumour of rectum, rectal cancer, malignant rectal tumor, malignant rectum tumour, malignant rectum tumor, cancer of rectum, malignant tumor of rectum, malignant rectum neoplasm, malignant rectal tumour, malignant neoplasm of the rectum, rectum cancer, malignant tumor of the rectum

label: reading disorder
definition: A learning disability involving difficulty reading resulting primarily from neurological factors which affect any part of the reading process.

label: reactive cutaneous fibrous lesion
definition: A benign, epidermal skin lesion characterized by overexpression of collagen during wound healing.

label: rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis
definition: Inflammation of the glomeruli that is characterized by a rapid loss in renal function with glomerular crescent formation observed on biopsy; it is often seen in patients with concomitant autoimmune disease, like Goodpasture's syndrome or systemic lupus erythematosus.
synonyms: RPGN

label: radiodermatitis
definition: A cutaneous inflammatory reaction occurring as a result of exposure to biologically effective levels of ionizing radiation.
synonyms: radiation-induced dermatitis, dermatitis radiation, radiation dermatitis, radiodermatitis

label: radiation-induced disorder
definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder which results from exposure to radiation. Examples of non-neoplastic disorders include dermatitis, enteritis, stomatitis, pneumonitis, and cerebritis. Examples of neoplastic disorders include myelodysplastic syndromes, leukemias, and sarcomas.
synonyms: radiation-induced Abnormality, radiation-induced abnormalities, radiation-induced disorder

label: radial neuropathy
definition: Disease involving the radial nerve. Clinical features include weakness of elbow extension, elbow flexion, supination of the forearm, wrist and finger extension, and thumb abduction. Sensation may be impaired over regions of the dorsal forearm. Common sites of compression or traumatic injury include the axilla and radial groove of the humerus.
synonyms: radial nerve peripheral neuropathy, peripheral neuropathy of radial nerve

qualitative or quantitative defects of protein SERCA1

qualitative or quantitative defects of delta-sarcoglycan

synonyms: alpha-sarcoglycanopathy
